examples: male animals serve the females for breeding purposes

results.definition: be used by; as of a utility
examples: The sewage plant served the neighboring communities
The garage served to shelter his horses

results.definition: be sufficient; be adequate, either in quality or quantity
examples: Nothing else will serve

results.definition: work for or be a servant to
examples: May I serve you?
The minister served the King for many years

results.definition: serve a purpose, role, or function
examples: The tree stump serves as a table
The female students served as a control group
This table would serve very well
His freedom served him well

results.definition: (sports) a stroke that puts the ball in play
examples: his powerful serves won the game

results.definition: deliver a warrant or summons to someone
help to some food; help with food or drink
examples: I served him three times, and after that he helped himself

results.definition: promote, benefit, or be useful or beneficial to
examples: Art serves commerce
Their interests are served
The lake serves recreation
The President's wisdom has served the country well

results.definition: spend time in prison or in a labor camp

examples: We serve meals for the homeless
The entertainers served up a lively show
The scandal served to increase his popularity

results.definition: devote (part of) one's life or efforts to, as of countries, institutions, or ideas
examples: She served the art of music
He served the church
serve the country

results.definition: do duty or hold offices; serve in a specific function
examples: He served as head of the department for three years
She served in Congress for two terms
She served in Vietnam
My sons never served, because they are short-sighted
It was Agassi's turn to serve
